content.question: Dr. Rickman is a mental health professional who believes that the diathesis-stress model best explains how psychological disorders develop. Which of the following statements best describes Dr. Rickmanâ€™s beliefs about the causes of psychological disorders?

choices.label: Dr. Rickman assumes that psychological disorders derive primarily from genetic factors.
Dr. Rickman emphasizes the importance of cultural practices as the dominant cause of psychological disorders.
Dr. Rickman believes that disorders develop from genetic vulnerability aggravated by adverse life experiences.
Dr. Rickman would argue that the environment is the only important contributor to psychological disorders.

content.answer: Dr. Rickman believes that disorders develop from genetic vulnerability aggravated by adverse life experiences.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
